emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Climate Adaptation
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that predict and adapt to climate change impacts, optimizing urban planning, agriculture, and disaster response.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances resilience against climate change but raises concerns about data privacy and economic disparities in access to technology.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant investment in AI infrastructure and regulatory frameworks to ensure ethical use.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Development of blockchain technologies that are resistant to attacks from quantum computers, ensuring long-term data security.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Secures digital transactions and records against future threats but requires widespread adoption to be effective.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on the advancement of quantum computing and the need for enhanced security measures.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Electric Aerial Vehicles (AEAVs)
emerging_technologies.description: Small, electric aircraft capable of urban transport, reducing road congestion and pollution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Transforms urban mobility, but introduces new challenges in airspace management and safety regulations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, public acceptance, and infrastructure for take-off and landing zones.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Wearables
emerging_technologies.description: Wearable devices that interface directly with the brain to enhance cognitive functions or control external devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for significant improvements in health and productivity, but raises ethical concerns about privacy and autonomy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in biocompatibility, user acceptance, and ethical guidelines.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Extraction
emerging_technologies.description: Technology for extracting and processing resources from celestial bodies like the moon or asteroids.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize manufacturing and energy sectors, but poses environmental and geopolitical challenges.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological feasibility, economic viability, and international space law.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Cities Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Comprehensive urban systems integrating IoT, AI, and autonomous systems for efficient resource management and citizen services.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in new urban developments; retrofitting existing cities ongoing.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Personal Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that manage personal schedules, health monitoring, and home automation, deeply integrated into daily life.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in developed nations, with growing acceptance in emerging markets.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in technology aimed at enhancing human cognitive capabilities through AI and neural interfaces.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Raises ethical questions about enhancement versus therapy, potential for social stratification, and the nature of human identity.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on education, productivity, and mental health; potential for new forms of inequality.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies and urban planning strategies to make cities more sustainable, resilient, and livable.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes better quality of life, reduces environmental impact, but might face resistance due to cost and privacy concerns.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Urbanization, climate change response, and the push towards zero-emission cities.
